questions.label: Neighborhood ID
questions.validations: yup.string().length(7, 'Must be exactly 7 digits').matches(/^[0-9]+$/, 'Must be only digits: 0-9').required()

questions.label: Municipality
Which of these services (from any source) are currently available in this Neighborhood/Town: (Check all that apply)
options: Community-based support groups for recovery from substance use (like AA, NA)
Access to in-patient treatment for substance use
Access to Medications for Opioid use Disorder (MOUD), like buprenorphine or methadone
Linkage to care and/or case management for HIV or HCV

questions.label: Other
Are there other related services/resources in this Neighborhood/Town not listed? (List up to 3)
What made you choose to focus on these services in this Neighborhood/Town (check all that apply)
options: Our organization has historically worked here
Community discussion or individual stories suggesting services are needed here
Grant funding was tied to working in this location
It is close to our main office / easily accessible
Prior Relationships with organizations in this Census Tract

questions.label: Other
What types of outreach services are available in this Neighborhood/Town (Check all that apply)
options: Office-based needle exchange and harm reduction services
Street-based needle exchange and harm reduction services

questions.label: Other community organizations(s)
Other
What are the known sources for naloxone available in this Neighborhood/Town? (Check all that apply)
options: Street-based needle exchange (walking route w/ backpack)

questions.label: Other community organization(s)
Other
[If 5 is endorsed] How many hours per week is this service available?
questions.validations: yup.number().min(0, 'Must be a non-negative number').max(168, 'Must be an number less than 168 since that is the maximum number of hours in a week')

questions.label: What are the sources for fentanyl test strips available in this Neighborhood/Town? (Check all that apply)
options: Street-based needle exchange (walking route w/ backpack

questions.label: Other community organization(s)
Other
[If 6 is endorsed] How many hours per week is this service available?
questions.validations: yup.number().min(0, 'Must be a non-negative number').max(168, 'Must be an number less than 168 since that is the maximum number of hours in a week')

questions.label: What are the sources for sterile needles and works in this Neighborhood/Town? (Check all that apply)
options: Street-based needle exchange (walking route w/ backpack)

questions.label: Other community organization(s)
Other
[If 7 is endorsed] How many hours per week is this service available?
questions.validations: yup.number().min(0, 'Must be a non-negative number').max(168, 'Must be an number less than 168 since that is the maximum number of hours in a week')

questions.label: What do you see as barriers to outreach in this Neighborhood/Town? (Check all that apply)
options: I don't know anyone who is familiar with this neighborhood
Limited community service organizations for partnerships
I don't know where there is a good place to distribute services
I do not have funding to distribute here
I do not have the time to go to these places
I don't think there are people here who would benefit from our services
I do not see many barriers

questions.label: Other
What do you see as strengths or opportunities for outreach and services in this Neighborhood/Town?
Please rate how much you Disagree or Agree with each of these statements
statements: It is easy to get sterile needles
It is easy to get new works (like cookers, cottons, sterile water)
It is easy to get fentanyl test strips
It is easy to get naloxone
It is easy to get access to healthcare services (low cost clinic, ED, free clinic)
It is easy to get to a licensed clinic/provider for methadone
It is easy to get to a licensed clinic/provider for buprenorphine
Police are visible or active here
Police are a barrier to service provision here
It is easy for people who use drugs to get services for basic needs (housing, food, financial assistance)
